snippet: American retailers extending their reach northward may seem like an obvious move, but until recently, the Canadian market was hard to crack.
abstract: Several American retailers are extending their reach northward into Canada, move that had in the past been avoided; stronger Canadian dollar, a relatively robust economy and a loosening of the commercial real estate market have made such investments more attractive.

headline.main: American Retailers Face Challenges in Expanding to Canada

byline.original: By IAN AUSTEN and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

snippet: Apple’s online store quickly burned through its initial inventory of new smartphones, forcing customers who ordered later in the day on Friday to wait.
abstract: Apple’s online store quickly burned through its initial inventory of new smartphones, forcing customers who ordered later in the day on Friday to wait.

headline.main: Signs of High Demand for the iPhone 5

snippet: Reggie Fils-Aime, head of Nintendo of America, says that Wii U and Nintendo TV show that the company is becoming more of a full-fledged entertainment business.

headline.main: One on One: Reggie Fils-Aime, President of Nintendo of America

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a study that shows that some mobile carriers are overcharging for data, where big technology money is going in t...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a study that shows that some mobile carriers are overcharging for data, where big technology money is going in the presidential campaign and a case that Apple's products are more complicated to use than they once were.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: H.P.'s Smartphone and Twitter's New Hacker

snippet: The managers of the Dow Jones industrial average said the change was made because Kraft was about to become a much smaller company after spinning off its North American grocery business.

headline.main: Kraft Foods to Leave Dow; UnitedHealth to Join
headline.print_headline: Kraft Foods to Leave Dow; UnitedHealth to Join

snippet: I neither love nor hate Apple.
abstract: I neither love nor hate Apple.

snippet: Apple's iPhone 5 got bigger than its predecessor, and some wonder why the company didn't make room for a technology called near-field communications (N.F.C.), which enables devices to exchange information wirelessly over very short distances. It a...
abstract: Apple's iPhone 5 got bigger than its predecessor, and some wonder why the company didn't make room for a technology called near-field communications (N.F.C.), which enables devices to exchange information wirelessly over very short distances. It appears that Apple chose beauty over added functions with its aluminum-and-glass phone.

headline.main: Why the iPhone 5 Does Not Have N.F.C. — It Can't

abstract: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.

snippet: Shares on Wall Street closed higher a day after the Federal Reserve gave a green light to big asset purchases to boost the American economy.
abstract: Stock indexes rise for a fourth consecutive session, closing out the week at nearly five-year highs after the Federal Reserve took bold action to spur the economy.

headline.main: Fed Action Keeps Rally Going for a 4th Day
headline.print_headline: Fed Action Keeps Rally Going for a 4th Day

snippet: If you think sales of the latest iPhone will help the economy, then you should support the government stepping in and doing more, too.
